trans-unit.source: Unplugged: Infection Simulation
trans-unit.target: アンプラグド： Infection Simulation

trans-unit.source:
For this activity, each student will need a micro:bit and battery pack, as well as the teacher who will be the Master controller.
There are four parts to this unplugged activity:
trans-unit.target:
For this アクティビティ, each student will need a micro:bit and battery pack, as well as the teacher who will be the Master controller.
There are four parts to this アンプラグド アクティビティ

trans-unit.source: Setup: Set up the code on all micro:bits
trans-unit.target: Setup: Set up the code on all micro:bits

trans-unit.source: Explore: Let students experience the game first
trans-unit.target: Explore: Let students experience the game first

trans-unit.source: Discuss: Talk about observations, theories, propose strategies
trans-unit.target: Discuss: Talk about observations, theories, propose strategies

trans-unit.source:
Test: Play again, testing different strategies and approaches for containing outbreak
The goals of this activity are:
trans-unit.target:
Test: Play again, testing different strategies and approaches for containing outbreak
The goals of this アクティビティ are:

trans-unit.source: Develop a common working vocabulary for talking about disease spread
trans-unit.target: Develop a common working vocabulary for talking about disease spread

trans-unit.source: Make inferences based on observation
trans-unit.target: Make inferences based on observation

trans-unit.source: Propose and test original hypotheses to explain complex behavior
trans-unit.target: Propose and test original hypotheses to explain complex behavior

trans-unit.source: Explore a professionally developed micro:bit simulation
trans-unit.target: Explore a professionally developed micro:bit simulation

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/radio/biohazard.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/radio/biohazard.png

trans-unit.source: Biohazard symbol
trans-unit.target: Biohazard symbol

trans-unit.source: Setup
trans-unit.target: Setup

trans-unit.source: This site is the home page for the Infection game: Infection.
trans-unit.target: This site is the home page for the Infection game: Infection.

trans-unit.source: On that page you should be able to copy the JavaScript code, then go to your MakeCode JavaScript editor and paste the JavaScript code into the window.
trans-unit.target: On that page you should be able to copy the JavaScript code, then go to your MakeCode JavaScript editor and paste the JavaScript code into the window.

trans-unit.source: Then click the Download button to download this program onto your micro:bit.
trans-unit.target: Then click ダウンロード ボタン to download this program onto your micro:bit.

trans-unit.source: This code should be downloaded onto all of your students’ micro:bits as well as your own.
trans-unit.target: This code should be downloaded onto all of your students’ micro:bits as well as your own.

trans-unit.source: This activity works best in an open area.
trans-unit.target: This アクティビティ works best in an open area.

trans-unit.source: If it’s possible to go outside, that works even better!
trans-unit.target: If it’s possible to go outside, that works even better!

trans-unit.source: To set up the game, the teacher should press the A + B buttons on his or her device.
trans-unit.target: To set up the game, the teacher should press the A + B buttons on his or her device.

trans-unit.source: This will register all of the student devices and establish the teacher’s micro:bit as the Master device.
trans-unit.target: This will register all of the student devices and establish the teacher’s micro:bit as the Master device.

trans-unit.source: Explore
trans-unit.target: Explore

trans-unit.source: In this phase, students should just play the game to get a feel for how it works.
trans-unit.target: In this phase, students should just play the game to get a feel for how it works.

trans-unit.source: The object of the game is to meet as many people as possible without getting sick.
trans-unit.target: The object of the game is to meet as many people as possible without getting sick.

trans-unit.source: If at any time players decide to stop meeting people, they should sit down and cover their micro:bit.
trans-unit.target: If at any time players decide to stop meeting people, they should sit down and cover their micro:bit.

trans-unit.source: To start the game, students should take their devices and spread out.
trans-unit.target: To start the game, students should take their devices and spread out.

trans-unit.source: When everyone is ready to begin, the teacher should press the A + B buttons again.
trans-unit.target: When everyone is ready to begin, the teacher should press the A + B buttons again.

trans-unit.source: All of the student devices will show a unique player icon.
trans-unit.target: All of the student devices will show a unique player icon.

trans-unit.source: One of the players is randomly chosen to have a virus that is transmitted when they meet other players.
trans-unit.target: One of the players is randomly chosen to have a virus that is transmitted when they meet other players.

trans-unit.source: Players can meet each other by going up to another player and placing the two devices next to each other.
trans-unit.target: Players can meet each other by going up to another player and placing the two devices next to each other.

trans-unit.source: Players who are healthy, or who are infected but are not showing symptoms yet, will have a smile.
trans-unit.target: Players who are healthy, or who are infected but are not showing symptoms yet, will have a smile.

trans-unit.source: Once a player is sick, their micro:bit will display a frowny face.
trans-unit.target: Once a player is sick, their micro:bit will display a frowny face.

trans-unit.source: After a certain period of time being sick, the player dies and the micro:bit will display a skull icon.
trans-unit.target: After a certain period of time being sick, the player dies and the micro:bit will display a skull icon.

trans-unit.source: That player should sit down and wait for the game to end, when all players are dead or the virus stops spreading.
trans-unit.target: That player should sit down and wait for the game to end, when all players are dead or the virus stops spreading.

trans-unit.source: Discuss
trans-unit.target: Discuss

trans-unit.source: After one round, it is good to have a discussion with the players:
trans-unit.target: After one round, it is good to have a discussion with the players:

trans-unit.source: Did anyone manage to stay healthy? If so, how? If not, why not?
trans-unit.target: Did anyone manage to stay healthy? If so, how? If not, why not?

trans-unit.source: How do you think the disease spread?
trans-unit.target: How do you think the disease spread?

trans-unit.source: Who do you think started it?
trans-unit.target: Who do you think started it?

trans-unit.source: What could we do to find out?
trans-unit.target: What could we do to find out?

trans-unit.source: What strategies might we adopt next time, to have a better outcome?
trans-unit.target: What strategies might we adopt next time, to have a better outcome?

trans-unit.source: Test
trans-unit.target: Test

trans-unit.source: Play the game one more time, or more depending on available time, and attempt to test some of the theories students came up with.
trans-unit.target: Play the game one more time, or more depending on available time, and attempt to test some of the theories students came up with.

trans-unit.source: * What strategies worked well?
trans-unit.target: * What strategies worked well?

trans-unit.source: * Which strategies seemed like a good idea at the time, but in practice, were less effective?
trans-unit.target: * Which strategies seemed like a good idea at the time, but in practice, were less effective?

trans-unit.source: Why?
trans-unit.target: Why?

trans-unit.source: * Are there any real-world situations that this might remind you of?
trans-unit.target: * Are there any real-world situations that this might remind you of?

trans-unit.source: Vocabulary
trans-unit.target: Vocabulary

trans-unit.source: As students talk through their theories, they will often talk about a scientific idea without knowing the specific word for it.
trans-unit.target: As students talk through their theories, they will often talk about a scientific idea without knowing the specific word for it.

trans-unit.source: This presents a nice opportunity, once students have surfaced an idea, to give it a proper name so that you can start to develop a common working vocabulary for talking about the problem.
trans-unit.target: This presents a nice opportunity, once students have surfaced an idea, to give it a proper name so that you can start to develop a common working vocabulary for talking about the problem.

trans-unit.source: Here are some common terms that come up in discussion: * Asymptomatic: Someone who has the virus but is not showing outward symptoms of being sick.
trans-unit.target: Here are some common terms that come up in discussion: * Asymptomatic: Someone who has the virus but is not showing outward symptoms of being sick.

trans-unit.source: * Carrier: Someone who has the virus and can transmit it to others.
trans-unit.target: * Carrier: Someone who has the virus and can transmit it to others.

trans-unit.source: * Immunity: Someone who cannot contract or transmit the virus.
trans-unit.target: * Immunity: Someone who cannot contract or transmit the virus.

trans-unit.source: * Incubation: The period of time between when a person contracts the virus and when the person starts to show symptoms of being sick.
trans-unit.target: * Incubation: The period of time between when a person contracts the virus and when the person starts to show symptoms of being sick.

trans-unit.source: * Inoculation: Make someone immune to the virus.
trans-unit.target: * Inoculation: Make someone immune to the virus.

trans-unit.source: * Patient Zero: The first person to introduce a virus to a community.
trans-unit.target: * Patient Zero: The first person to introduce a virus to a community.

trans-unit.source: * Quarantine: A strategy to isolate those who are suspected of carrying a virus
trans-unit.target: * Quarantine: A strategy to isolate those who are suspected of carrying a virus

trans-unit.source: Reference
trans-unit.target: リファレンス

trans-unit.source: This game is a distributed simulation of a viral outbreak.
trans-unit.target: This game is a distributed simulation of a viral outbreak.

trans-unit.source: It is modeled after the Thinking Tags participatory simulations developed at MIT Media Lab.
trans-unit.target: It is modeled after the Thinking Tags participatory simulations developed at MIT Media Lab.

trans-unit.source: Participatory Simulations have been found to enhance student understanding of complex dynamic relationships, inquiry skills, and scientific understanding.
trans-unit.target: Participatory Simulations have been found to enhance student understanding of complex dynamic relationships, inquiry skills, and scientific understanding.

trans-unit.source: (Colella, V.
trans-unit.target: (Colella, V.

trans-unit.source: Participatory Simulations: Building Collaborative Understanding Through Immersive Dynamic Modeling.
trans-unit.target: Participatory Simulations: Building Collaborative Understanding Through Immersive Dynamic Modeling.

trans-unit.source: Journal of the Learning Sciences, 9(4), 471–500. http://dx.doi.org/10.1207/S15327809JLS0904_4)
trans-unit.target: Journal of the Learning Sciences, 9(4), 471–500. http://dx.doi.org/10.1207/S15327809JLS0904_4)
